Summary Heading: Good value for the price; a lot of the low reviews from several years ago, great location
Summary: This was a terrific location right in the harbor. There were nice restaurants and shops right next door The room was good sized and clean (except the aircon filter could have used going over for sure) and the bed comfortable enough. The pool was clean and uncrowded. Breakfast was on par with a Quality Inn or Comfort Inn type offering. I like that we had a mini kitchen set up.  Tours were walking distace away and close to Coast Highway, gas stations, and CA 5. There was also a liquor store in the harbor for making your own drinks.  Free parking
Room tip: The rooms were quite quiet. You may want to ask for a view.

Summary Heading: For $100/night - it's still better than Motel 6
Summary: Pros:  ~ Proximity to water ~ Free, in-room coffee ~ Mini-fridge ~ Nice LCD TV ~ Free internet ~ Continental Breakfast ~ Ironing board/Hair dryer  Cons: ~ Slow, frustrating wifi internet ~ Dated facilities ~ Even slower elevator ~ Inadequate parking ~ Loud climate control system ~ Stairs difficult to access  Despite all the negatives - this dockside "Motel" still beats the spartan amenities Motel 6 currently offers. Reserve early and request third-level, harborside views. It sells out fast, but there is no upcharge whatsoever.
Room tip: Get third level, harbor view room. No upcharge...but first-come, first-served only.

Summary Heading: Excellent location, Comfortable and reasonably priced
Summary: This hotel is conveniently located on the Dana Point Marina and near shopping and attractions. Whale/Dolphin watching boat tours just a block away. The rooms are comfortable and some have a great view of the marina. It needs updating but has everything you need including free wi-fi and free breakfast. The beds are comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful.
Room tip: Rooms facing the marina are extra. Rooms around the courtyard are less and have a view from the...

Summary: This place is dirty. Our room had stained carpets, dirt around the Air conditioner unit and just an overall crummy experience. The air conditioner was very loud--had to keep turning the TV up whenever the unit would kick on. In addition, very poor lighting. I understand the need for energy conservation however, they should use LED bulbs instead of CFL's. What does it take to clean the carpets and dust once in a  while???

Worn out, dirty and the pool area was full of construction equipment. We are local and we needed to stay out of our place for a night, oh my, I would have been very upset if I was on vacation and came here. It's a shame because the location is pretty nice-close to the beach and harbor. A funny thing was there were three "paintings" in the room and they were all the same painting! :)

Arrived 1-17-2014 for 1 night.  Assigned room.  Entered room to find one of the two beds rumpled and the toilet contained feces.  Contacted front desk and requested another queen room, as per our pre-paid contract.  Room assigned was only double beds.  Maid was cleaning other rooms and I peeked in to only see double beds, no queens as advertised.  Back to front desk and asked where our queen beds were?  Desk person hemmed and hawed and admitted only King and double beds available.  We were upgraded to a King bed (the only one available). The room was "well used"  Window sills filthy, hadn't been dusted in quite a while.  Bathroom had paint pealing and unpainted patched drywall repairs in tub area.  In the vanity area, outside the bathroom, florescent tubes burnt out, very little
Room tip: Go for the King size bed.  There are no Queen size beds.

Summary Heading: Stay anywhere but here, you will regret it.
Summary: I wouldn't recommend this inn to anyone, even if the room rate was free. From our experience, it is just not worth it. The way the property is managed is anything but professional, actually management could be described as an absolute joke. You will regret it after checking out - ripped off. I too was overcharged for the stay with additional charges, though the stay was completely paid for in advance. The matter was not resolved, not through lack of trying on our part though. Basically all contact to resolve the issue with the staff and the manager was ignored.
Room tip: There wouldn't be any good rooms.

Summary: I was overcharged for my stay.  My credit card was charged for an extra reservation that I did not make.  Management was not helpful and I never got this resolved.  I finally had to call my credit card to dispute the charges.  Besides the financial damage.....  the hotel was old and dingy. The stairwell caught on fire during our stay.  The police showed up quite a bit over the weekend.  We did not feel safe.

So, roommate decided to have a party last minute and I ended up getting a hotel since I had to work early the next day. Did a little hotel hunting and found this hotel on Orbitz for a pretty cheap rate... unfortunately, I did not read reviews prior to my check in so I was travelling blind...   I made my reservation at 5:00pm and came to check in at 7:00pm... not the best check in experience... Two of my front desk pet peeves happened during check in.   First... long check in process. I get it, there is a lot of information to cover with arriving guests. However, if you know there is a lot of information, why do you have long stretches of silence during the check in process? For example, tell me about the breakfast while the credit card authorizes not after the authorization went

We stayed here Oct.10-13,2013. Rock- hard bed, faucets backward,shower either scalding or freezing, mold in shower, outdated furnishings from the 1970's. Smokers outside a "non-smoking room", I called the front desk to see if we could check- out after one night- they said no- because we booked online and paid for two nights. Never again- this place is dirty and outdated- needs to be torn down!

We stayed for one night on our way to LA. The room we had was very large and well equipped, including  a large bathroom and separate dressing room area as well. The bed was comfortable and sheets were crisp and clean. After reading some of the reviews we were concerned but  we didn't need to be.   We found the staff pleasant and helpful and the breakfast was basic but nice. The beach was 5 minutes away  along with the harbour with plenty of restaurants to choose from.    We had trouble using the wifi and to be fair they tried to sort this out  but only staying one night not sure if they ever solved the problem.  If we are ever passing we would book this motel again.

Place is small and clean and good for one night or a couple of nights. We travel most times here for Thanksgiving and are content here. It located right up the road from Doheny State Beach which has stores and restaurants. They have a breakfast buffet typical of small motels or you can go to I.HOP across the street.  They are small, only 46 rooms but in a great location for family fun. Room has a refrigerator and a microwave in lobby if you need to warm something up..

We have stayed at this motel several times in the past and never had any issues - until NOW. My wife called & booked a room on Monday for the next Saturday night (AAA rate) because we were seeing a concert at The Coach House for her birthday. The girl that helped us on the phone was Stephanie, and she was very pleasant. Now my wife is very organized and a stickler for details. She verified the date, room rate, and 48 hour cancellation policy. Stephanie said to avoid being charged we needed to cancel by Thursday (48 hours before Saturday, for the math fans). My wife asked for an email confirmation but Stephanie said the motel was having computer issues so they could not email the confirmation, but she did give us a confirmation number. Later in the week we got a call from the

This hotel was a nightmare and I wish I had read more reviews prior to booking.  We drove to Dana Point from Arizona and arrived around 8 PM to check in.  Once we got our key we walked into our room to find it already occupied, by bugs.  Not bed bugs (not that we found anyway) but there were more there than our liking.  As we further inspected the room we found a FRENCH FRY in clear view sitting between the bed and the nightstand.  After spending about 45 minutes on our phones finding a new hotel, we went back to the front desk to inform the girl we were no longer going to stay here and wanted to cancel the rest of the reservation and get our money back.  This is where the story gets interesting.  She informed me that she in unable to give refunds and that the manager has to do

I have never been in a hotel that smelled as bad nor had actual mold in the showerhead.  We were moved from the first room because the door would not close.  I can understand why as it smelled so bad.  The office staff called the manager as well as maintenance and no one showed.  We tried to get our money back after 15 minutes so we could go somewhere else but no go.  I slept in my clothes as the sheets were filthy.  Wish I knew who owned it so I could get some kind of refund.  The office staff just kept apologizing but still we paid full price.  Don't go there.

Have stayed here for over 12 years with our family, we have referred many friends and have noticed over the past 5 years its become more & more run down but we over looked it because price, location was good and  we were always treated with respect from the staff.  Sadly to say that the manager does not care about their returning patrons.  Myself and 3 others stayed here 8/12/13 and I was so embarrassed! Woke up to roaches in the bed & bath,  faucets were broken, coffee pot did not work I went to the front desk and complained about the roaches (I have a video and showed it to the male staff member at his request) and was told that the manager would be in btwn 9 & 10 am...he never came in, they said they e-mailed him numerous times but no reply. I asked for some kind of

We booked this hotel by accident on hotwire not realizing the area for Laguna Beach included Dana Point.  For $100, when most hotels are $200 in the area, this is a fantastic deal. I don't know what people are complaining about. The hotel was clean, heated tile floors in the bathroom, quiet at night, good beds, breakfast was adequate, and it was in walking distance to the beach. I would consider this hotel better than many more expensive brand name hotels.   When we were there the beaches in Laguna were too rough for swimming and surfing. We finally walked to the beach near the hotel and it was great for swimming with our kids.  From the reviews we knew the pool was closed so we were fine with that.

We stayed for one night after getting a discount through Hotwire. The room was spacious and comfortable and appeared clean, and the girl at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Location is excellent - we walked to the beach and to food as well. The furnishings and decorations could use an update, but for the relative price, I wont complain. No problems with noise or safety. We realized the morning that we left that the carpets were in fact rather dirty, but that is my only complaint.

Was in a jam for a room and should have wondered why I got so lucky.  1st room smelled very bad and so we got moved to another, which smelled just a little less.  The location is within walking distance to Doheny Beach.   I did worry about security as the doors all open out to the parking lot and there isn't always the most trustworthy people walking around the area.  We used the AC to block out the street noise.

Good location for beach and harbour.ok accommodation for short break.comp breakfast ok to start the day not substantial.housekeeping good.we had lower floor room big mistake extremely noisy people upstairs.front desk staff pleasant.

Nothing more to say.  Stay away. I researched this hotel and found that on Tripadvisers the review was that their pool was closed due to violations with the health department.  So, before I made the reservation, I called and was told that the pool was open. When we arrived, we found that the pool had been closed for day.  They said that they were "painting" the pool. This was a lie, there was no evidence of "painting."  We left and were not refunded out money. We paid for a hotel with a pool, and didn't get a pool.  Scum.

This Motel is in a great spot for finding. We stayed for three nights. The sheets were never changed! There was a card telling you how they are trying to save the planet by using less water and soap. I asked the girl at the desk to please have the sheets changed after 2 nights. The maid did not do it , even after I left a tip to in courage her. After all the word TIP means "To Insure Prompt Service. I guess if you want clean beds in California you better pay $200 or more per night!

If your looking for fancy, it's not the place. I was extremely happy with the location. It was perfect for all my activities I had planned. We went whale watching and paddle boarding. Both of those activities where close to the hotel. The beach is within walking distance. You have several choices to choose from within walking distance. Everything worked out well.

Our stay at the inn was good for the price we paid.From the pics I thought that I had two king beds but turns out the room has a wall of mirror and made the illusion that there were two beds. The pool was closed by the health department, the computer in the lobby did not work and the wi- fi signal was very weak.

My family and I stayed here for two nights. I'm pretty easy going and certainly not picky BUT  This place is filthy!!!! The floors were so dirty our feet were black 10 min after our showers. GROSS!! There were hard things stuck to the counters and the walls and door were very dirty.... noticably dirty !!We were also very disappointed that the POOL HAD BEEN SHUT DOWN BY THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT!! When asked the girl at the front desk about it. She acted like it was no big deal and that we were out of luck because we made reservations through Expedia. If we had made them through the hotel we would have a refund. When we returned home I had Expedia contact the hotel and they refused anything other that 25% off our next visit. That will never happen. I don't think you could pay us to

hotel was excellent.  right on the water.  zach was so helpful and because of him we will definately stay there again.  we were able to rent the paddle boats with ease.  we want to come back in october and this is where we will stay for sure.

Hotel was conveniently located to our 10K race which made it ideal. We had originally booked a king room but had extra people joining us so they gave us 2 queens at no extra charge which was extremely helpful. Room was large and clean and beds were comfortable. Bathroom had a huge counter which was a nice surprise. They provide refrigerators but could have used a small microwave too. The down side of this hotel is it seemed a little sketchy with some of the people milling around the rooms, I was thankful for my husbands presence. The pool area was probably the worst I have ever seen at a hotel, it was clean but the location was awful. Overall for the priced paid it was a great hotel, I am just use to a little more.

Summary Heading: Easy walking distance to the beach
Summary: We stayed here for 1 night.  It was an easy walk to the beach.  We walked there twice. We liked the nice size room.  We were told that we were getting queen beds.  They seemed more like doubles.  It was nice having two sinks.  We also liked the good size fridge.  We called the breakfast the "miniature" breakfast.  Everything was in miniature size :)  This allowed us to try different things.

Summary Heading: Great location but not up to normal standard of motel/hotel comfort.
Summary: Close to the Dana Harbor area if you were without car only two long blocks to all restaurant & shops in the harbor area. If your into boat, fishing or whale watching trips perfect location too with or without car.  The room 111 even though it's perfect for handicap person large enough and bathroom made for the need.  The knob on the cold was broken back of the bathroom door had a dent as if someone punched it leaving a somewhat hole.  Three painting in the rooms were all exactly the same. Theses are simply things that can be fixed overnight but looks like they don't care enough to put any effort into their Inn.  In my opinion it seemed like their only concern was to bring in as many people who cares how the place or rooms looks.  It saved us very little money compared to other

Stayed at Dana Point Inn whilst travelling US for three nights. The staff were great, i made a boo and booked for days the week previous, receptionist was excellent and looked after us perfectly finding us a room.I will be honest, this is not a luxury hotel,but the room was very spacious, serviced well, had a wide range of TV Channels and the location was great. We could walk to the beach, and drove to various towns each night of our stay.For the money personally i couldn't complain added bonus was the small Continental Breakfast spread every morning and the quality of Coffee was exceptional.Good parking facilities too!

The hotel met our needs perfectly.  We wanted an inexpensive place where we could walk to the Dana Point Turkey Trot on Thanksgiving morning.  It is dated, but the room was clean and in decent shape.  The bed was okay and the fan worked well. There was a continental breakfast in the morning (unexpected).  It was nothing elaborate but it was a great for a pre-race snack.  Overall, the hotel met our expectations. It was inexpensive, clean and in a great location.  Don't expect glamour...it isn't there.    In looking at the other reveiw, I checked for bed bugs (even brought my bug killer) but did not find any evidence of a problem!!

Dana Point Marina Inn is clean, comfortable, reasonably priced, and a lovely location near the Dana Point Harbor and Marina.  It's our go to place to stay so we are convenient to our family for overnights.  Other members of our family have been staying here for some time and now we have become regular visitors as well.

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY HERE!  BED BUGS!
Summary: We made reservations here, day of, for 7 rooms.   Only three of the rooms had even checked into their rooms.  Within an hour of checking in, our bus driver found bed bugs in the room (he saw evidence and also travels with a black light).  We immediately told the hotel that we could not stay there.  (One member of our party had already been hospitalized for a past incident with bed bugs- no taking chances).  No way were we going to stay at a hotel with obvious bug issues. They told us they had not yet run the card.  Well, they lied, I just looked and they charged us for all the rooms!  And to make matters worse, they had the nerve to say it was fleas as if that was better!  I called to talk to the hotel and give them a chance to make good, and they said there is nothing they can

Summary Heading: clean, friendly, and walking distance can't be beat!
Summary: If you want a fancy resort then you won't be spoiled. However, we had clean, quiet, friendly service. Breakfast was small, but if you are in a hurry it suffices. Awesome Madeline cookies too! Room had a fresh smell, and sorry, for those claiming bed bugs, no bed bugs. Now there are little red beetles on the beach, that if you don't shake out your towels or other things they will hook a ride with you to your room. But, we were careful about shaking out our beach items before we left.  Everyday, fresh sheets, towels and wonderful service when you needed something. I want to let you know this place was not a dump! I don't stay in dumps, The price is excellent and I will definetly come back to this hotel.  Diane S.

Summary Heading: Good place to crash, not luxury if that's what you seek!
Summary: Good location, soft towels, and nice people. Small breakfast selection.  We were a little worried when we walked in to see a full ceiling to floor mirror next to the bed, but there were no hourly rates, so we figured it was safe! ;)

This hotel is the picture of a dump!!!  Rooms and doors, in fact the whole building needs painting, the TVs were built two centuries ago, the morning breakfast is a joke, and believe it or not, their washer and dryer for the guess is in the pool area (How Tacky can you get).  The driveway is in desperate need of repaving, and management is at best rude.

Location is as promised, right across the street from the beach. Breakfast was as expected for the price consisting of store bought goods (two types of cold cereal, oatmeal, mini bagels, mini cinnamon rolls, yogurt, cookies, and coffee). Convenient mini-fridge. Beds were standard comfort. Room smelled a little funky, but we got used to it. Swimming pool was small and old, but who cares when you're right next to the beach!  All that being said, we would not recommend this place do to the fact we found 3 Bed Bugs crawling on the bathroom floor which were already red in color, which according to the research we did, means they already fed off of somebody's blood. We gave the bugs in a folded tissue to the front desk and they said they would show it to the manager, but one will

Summary Heading: Convenient to the beach and cheap. Don't go expecting a nice room to lounge in.
Summary: We stayed just one night and the location was perfect for walking across the street to the beach, which was our reason for being there.  Our room was dated and not terribly clean, it also had an old funky odor. We did not walk on the carpet without shoes on. When we went to bed I unfolded the blanket and encountered a spot on the edge that was crusty and white. Needless to say I quickly washed my hands and went to the car for some blankets.  The room next to us was being occupied by some local surfers, they were friendly enough, but spent a lot of time smoking on the walk right outside our room, so we were unable to leave the window open for fresh air as the smoke just blew right in.  We stayed on a Saturday night and it was a bit rowdy and loud early in the evening, but it did

We checked in here went to our room there was urine and bugs all over the bathroom they refused to give me another room or refund my money. They also refused to tell me who owned it or managed it . By far the worst place I've ever stayed.

I was worried about the bad review I kept seeing online. I called them to inquire about them. I spoke to Alissa, and she was very respectful and understanding. She explained that some past guest have damaged linen and were charged for them. She also said that guest will take the keys with them and they have to be charge for them, that the charges are all explained when they sign-in. When I check-in, Viany was also very sweet, and she told me about the complementary breakfast, free wi-fi and explained the damage policy. The room was very nice. The ocean is right across the street and the girls very helpful when I called to request a taxi. I returned my key the next day and again the girls were sweet. For the price this place is wonderful.

my husband and i said here in the end of Jan. they was nice at first then charged our credit cards after 2 days of checking out for dirty towels and a smoking fee told us we could not get are deposit back. and please stay off there grounds i thought it was a good please at first. but in the end i should have never stopped there. finally in march we got are refund back but after the rude people and disrespect for everyone there i would give this a 1/2 of star. nasty place nasty people

I stayed at this hotel last summer when I reunited with a high school classmate who lived nearby. The price was more than reasonable considering the price comparisons I made. My room was clean, no mold and no bugs. The continental breakfast was substantial (cereals, toasts, sweet breads, yogurt, coffee, juices and fruit) and fresh. Internet available in the lobby and a state beach nearby. I will definitely book again.

My boyfriend and I stayed here on 29 Feb, and to be fair it was an ok stay, a bit noisy but the room was nice. However now that I am back in the UK, they have charged my credit card for not returning the room key. As I know the exact time we left and could describe the girl who I returned the key to, I am far from impressed that this hotel has charged me.   If they are not competent enough to take care of a room key that has been returned, I would not like to stay here again as who knows who gets given the keys.   I have complained to the hotel regarding this, and asked that they check video camera to confirm (I know exact time that we left as we had to be somewhere for a specific time) and they just repeated that I did not hand back the key.

Only stay here if you like cock roaches and getting ripped off!!!   I stayed here one night in the first part of January for my son's baseball tournament.  We didn't get any sleep due to the smoke alarm chirping ALL night as it needed a battery.Unfortunatley,I couldn't call anyone to change the battery as it didn't start chriping until after the office was closed.The bed sheets smelled like sour milk, the room like musty old smoke and the walls were filthy dirty!!! when I got up in the morning to take a shower, I turned on the bathroom light only to see cockroaches scatter!!!! I was soooo grossed out, I killed one took it to the front desk and advised of my hellish night with no sleep and encountering cockroaches. The front desk agent just looked at me like this wasn't anything

We needed a moderately priced hotel in Dana Point to be convenient to the harbor and services we needed.  Dana Point Harbor Inn was suggested, and we made the reservations sight unseen.  We were delighted with the location--on Harbor Drive, right around the corner from the entrance arches to the city of Dana Point and within walking distance to shops, restaurants, etc..  The room was super roomy, with a convenient dressing area separate from the rest of the room, a good sized refrigerator, and a handy place to sit..  The hotel also provided a decent breakfast buffet each day.

I was appalled when reading how many times this place has run a scam with people's credit cards! I am in the process of a dispute with them myself.  I booked the room for 2 nights for December. When I called to cancel/change the dates, was told I didn't have a reservation for December, but for September and was charged on my credit card. When I called the front desk, they said. " Unfortunately, I didn't cancel in time, and there was nothing they could do!" Can you believe this??? It was their mistake. The front desk booking agent is Samira and she just doesn't take responsibility for this. I got the runaround from her saying she had to talk to her manager MO. Well, apparently MO is never there, nor does he return calls, and you cannot get an answer from these people.  They are

Summary Heading: Its just a hotel people, temporary! its not a permanent stay.
Summary: Lets get real people and stop complaining. Its just for a temporary stay. The front desk agents do what they can. There is housekeeping and a maintenance man who keep up the property daily. Theres a bed, shower, toilet , fridge and a T.V. Basic necessities! If you need extra towels, soap, coffee the front desk will happily provide more. I know for a fact that the front desk agents are hospitable and friendly. They greet and accomodate you as much as possible. Theres a great complimentary continential breakfast with delicious chocolate chip muffins. No its not the Ritz or any other 5 star hotel but if youre just looking for a place to sleep at night Dana Point Harbor Inn is definately a great option. The beach is directly across the street, behind the Inn is many restuarants and
Bathroom sink pipe was broken, as a courtesy I attempted to clean as mush as I could. THEY CHARGED ME FOR STAINED TOWELS!!!! Then the runaround began when I called them after I got my c.c. statement.

Summary Heading: WISH I STAYED AT THE LOCAL HOLIDAY INN!
Summary: This stay felt like a motel.  The area is nice, but this place makes you feel like you are not in CA.  First, let me start by saying that the bed sheets need to be replaced with new ones, ours were very old. The bathroom had mold, the remote was old and had tape securing the cover on the back.  The towelused as a floormat in the bathroom  was nicely folded  and was DIRTY.Oh and let's not forget the broken water faucet .  The place was literally a pit stop.  The carpet was also filthy.  The reps at the front desk did not even greet us in the morning as we ate the lousy breakfast which was surrounded by fruit flies thanks to the extremely ripe bananas they offered.  NEVER AGAIN will we stay here.

We stayed here one night while driving from Vegas to San Diego.  Excellent location, very safe and very good room.  Free wifi, Free breakfast, coffeemaker.  The price was right and we enjoyed our stay.  Walked across the street to spend time at the park and enjoyed the view of the Pacific Ocean from there.

Summary Heading: Worst motel I've ever stayed in. We almost drove home instead of staying.
Summary: First of all. The smell. It smelled like someone peed on the carpet then  hosed down the room with 409. And we had 7 total rooms in out group, and they were all the same, so it wasn't just our room.  You could smell it even standing outside the room.   They wouldn't let me check in because the name was under my husband's first name, same last name.  The pool was dingy looking. Didn't tempt me to go in at all.  The ice maker wasn't working the whole time we were there.  Not worth the $150 we spent at all.   The pluses? There was a fridge. Free parking. Continental breakfast. Location (very close to Doheney State Beach, where we were going to a music festival.)

They are running a scam!  We booked 2 rooms/3 nights directly with them only to be sitting on the beach in San Diego during the first part of our vacation week to be told they were sorry but they did not have our rooms for us and that they had booked us rooms about a mile away - they said computer error.  When we arrived at the new place it was a total DUMP - we wouldn't even let our dogs stay there.  We tried to talk to the manager at Dana Point Harbor Inn and he totally avoided us.   We ended up going to the Best Western and paying last minute high prices for 2 rooms/2nights and cutting our vacation a day short.  My family repeatedly tried to talk to the manager  but he never returned our calls.  Beware!!!!

Summary Heading: We Loved it and Had a Great Time!
Summary: I booked five rooms for my daughter's wedding in March, for an August wedding. I made many changes during the six months of reserving the rooms, and we ended up with some confused reservations, but Sarah and Janet helped me a lot and worked everything out for me. They were very helpful. I confirmed my rooms a lot and checked things over. When we arrived my mother's room was way down away from where the rest of the rooms were, and Britt spent a lot of time working it out so she would be right next to me. He also spent a lot of time getting my reservations straightened out for me. In general, the location of the motel and the room accommodations were great. I would say that one problem was in taking a shower, because the hot water comes and goes, but I have had that problem in

We finally got away from work due to a close friend's wedding and why not take advantage of it and enjoy an extra couple of days by the ocean? I really wanted to stay at the Marriot, Laguna cliffs and no its not by Laguna beach! but at Dana Point. We searched through every hotel search possible and we kept seeing Dana Point Harbor Inn at the lowest price search criteria. Ofcourse getting away from work after a long long time, I did not want to stay at a cheap place but one which was worth the money and the treatment. My wife without hesitation booked at this place to save a bit of extra money so she can shop a bit more. Without a doubt, I am very happy she did book this place because it was perfect for the price, we paid an average of $99 for Friday & Saturday night with AAA

Summary Heading: SCAM - Dont Let It Happen To You
Summary: If your travel plans are during the summer there is a good chance you will not be staying at the Dana Point Harbor Inn per your reservations. This Hotel (which is sub-par at best) advertises inexpensive rates, over books and then provides alternative accommodations down the street (which I am sure has some connection) at a hotel that is not suitable for a dog kennel. If you book through Orbits or Hotwire you will not receive a refund and I guarantee you will end up paying for a different hotel and at the end of the day you should have just paid for a nice hotel and enjoyed your vacation. For what it’s worth – DO NOT BOOK AT THIS HOTEL! Read all 50 something reviews – this is not an isolated event.

My friend was getting married on the weekend of July 16th.  I should have paid attention to the reviews before booking.......I think the place has fleas and they used my credit card number without my authorization.  My friend had left his tie at the hotel and a week later I get a package wit a tie and a receipt for $23.67 charged to my account from a UPS store.  The tie wasn't even woth that much!!  I had to cancel the account before they charged more stuff on it!  How dare they!!!

Summary Heading: STOP - DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL-PLEASE!
Summary: Stop right here....back away....if you choose to stay in this hotel you subject yourself to a terrible time, unclean rooms, dirty pool (the size of a hot tub the picture is on an angle) and people that work here that do not care if they cheat you or if you have any complaints. I am from Ohio,. My whole family came from four states for my nephews wedding.  We booked this hotel due to rates, location, and pictures.  My parents and aunt and uncle came from Tennessee.  Same day we were all traveling they contacted them and told them they overbooked their rooms and did not have anymore available at this location.  They told them they got them a room down the road.  Yeah,...at another dirt bag towel place that this manager was over.  It also was a dump!  Taco beds that swerved in the

We have lived in Dana Point, and came down for a quick trip from florida. You get what you pay for. Yes its dated, we found our room clean, beds were not the best, but its a place to sleep and shower, Really how long are you planning on hanging out in you room while on holidays? There are great beaches and restaurants nearby.  The staff is nice, they are doing there job, you get  hot coffee, bagels and cereal, if you want more there is a Dennys across the street and there is a local diner called the harbor house great cheap food served 24hrs  Lets get real people and stop complaining.   And if you like there is a great Marriott  up the street for $250.00 per night.

this is not a hotel, it is a motel  the a/c is the cheap motel kind that makes too much noise all night--- yet you need that noise so you don't hear anyone else around you  the room stank of cleaning fluid-- had to air out the room  rooms have not been painted in 20 years--- not sure why they put granite counters in-- you can't turn a  Kia into a Ferrari  tons of smokers stay at the hotel, but since there are no smoking rooms, they all linger outside and smoke and stare at everyone  they have a made up policy if you book and prepay on orbitz, where you still have to give them another $50 deposit... they must have a lot of criminal activity here  i did not like the microchip keys they use  oh well... for $85 it still is an ok value--- they need to write out their policies more

After reading all the reviews and trying to decide whether or not to book for Doheny Jazz Festival in May, we stopped by on our way home this past weekend. It's cheap alright, IF there's not a jazz festival across the street. When I called 2 weeks ago,I was told $65 for a King and $75 for double queens. When  we got there, (Jan 24th), I noticed a room being cleaned, so before we went to the office I poke my head in: Old, dated looking,,,,not what you'd expect for $65....more like $50!  Old, worn looking bedspreads, old smell to the room. Tiny pool, with old patio chairs, behind wrought iron. Whole place looks like it serves as hooker heaven when there's no jazz festival. Only thing it has gong for it it the location: right across the street from the festival site. So, into the
Cockroaches, lousy beds, thin walls (heariing sex in the middle of the night), staff don't know how to manage counter.  "Coninentil Breakfast"???  Which continent?  Road Noise...oh boy!

This hotel is a block away from a beautiful park on the ocean.  Otherwise, not worth the money.  Refrigerator, hair dryer, shower, internet;  you name it -- nothing worked properly.  Staff was unhelpful and apparently all too used to these complaints.

Why oh why did I not check trip advisor before booking this hotel?  I wasn’t expecting much at all (especially for the price) but I didn’t even get a chance to assess my stay since it didn’t happen.  I was traveling from San Francisco to Dana Point for a friend’s wedding and I had booked a room online using my credit card.  Yes, I should have called to confirm but since I’ve never had a problem with a hotel’s online booking system it wasn’t something I thought to do.  I called the day of to let them know that my date would be the one checking in at which point the front desk lady informed me they had no room booked for me.  I told her I was staring at a confirmation number emailed to me by the hotel and that I had given my credit card info and she told me sometimes their online

Summary Heading: Practical, Inexpensive and Convenient - Not Luxury
Summary: This hotel is the one to choose for location only.  In this area, almost everything is a resort, and is priced accordingly.  For a cheap place to stay that's still equally (or more) convenient when compared to the big resorts, this is a good option.

Summary Heading: Be Afraid, Be Very, Very Afraid
Summary: We first must wholeheartedly agree with the other 1 point raters (reading their reviews assured us we weren’t in the Twilight Zone). This motel (using the term loosely) does not really care about service. We would like to add a few more of our own tales from house of horrors. Went through ORBitz; had no problem with reservation.  Our room, #206, was clean enough but the outside light was out and we couldn’t see squat. We notified front desk of the problem and were told it couldn’t be fixed until the next morning. OK We needed ice. It took 2 calls to the front desk and 2 trips up and down the poorly lit stairs before we got the ‘secret’ on how to open the gate.(Here’s the secret…it’s a child safety lock, reach up and over the top of the gate and unlatch it) Who knew!.  We slept

My friend and I stayed at this hotel last night. We have stayed here once before too (the experience first time was GREAT- we got a room on the top floor and the room was clean, smelled new, and way nicer than the ghetto old dirty rooms below...ANYWAY. we are both heavy cigarette smokers so we probably have a lingering smoke stench on our clothes....., and we totally obeyed the rules and smoked outside our room. However, in the morning around 1030 on the way to the lobby to get our 100$deposit They told us that our room smelled like MARIJUANA. YAH thats right. ARE you kidding mE????? I almost started cracking up until I realized they were serious and almost did not give our money back and wanted to alos charge 250$!! We told them that ther was no way in the world we smoked in

Summary Heading: Alright for the price we paid but not very clean and incompetent staff
Summary: When we got there, they had trouble finding our reservation. When we finally got our rooms, there were a couple of little cockroaches in the shower - gross! We were able to change the rooms, but they didn't seem to be very sorry! Also, we weren't allowed to print a one-page document at the front desk that we urgently needed, not even offering to pay for it - bad service. But location is good, place is quiet and you are close to Laguna Beach and don't need to spend a fortune.

I made a reservation in person several days in advance and was given my choice of several rooms with 2 queen beds, one for our young kids.  After booking room #219 we returned on Saturday at 5pm to be told #219 as taken.  OK then, we went to the one given us instead only to find 1 bed, not 2.  I went to reception and I was told no more rooms were available, and they did not have cots or a fold out bed for our children.  Where dd they expect our kids to sleep, on the floor?  We had to leave and find another hotle at the last minute.  Unbelievably bad service, THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR GUESTS!

Long story.  We booked online with credit card, received confirmation. The week of travel both my wife and I called at different times to ask some simple questions.  Each time the desk clerk asked for our phone number and said she would call back.  Never happened. After flying in from out of state, renting a car, we arrived to an empty counter and gave the clerk my last name and copy of hotel confirmation.  She and another employee quickly left the room and returned with the news, "we just now pulled your reservation off the website but do not have a room for you.  We won't penalize you or charge your credit card...Sorry."  They both stood, straight faced looking at me like this is not new and is much rehearsed.  Knowing that this small hotel couldn't free up room space my only

Summary Heading: Decent hotel with a horribly incompetent front desk staff.
Summary: The hotel was a fairly good value, especially considering its location.   The rooms were clean and in decent shape.  Its not the fanciest place, but its not a dive either.  The places only real problem is the front desk staff.  When we arrived, no one could find our reservation.  After the two girls behind the desk looked for about half an hour, a third girl showed up who a bit brighter than the other two and she was able to track it down.  Apparently there reservations are made thru some travel agency, and they had never faxed it over.  So if you make a reservation here call a few days ahead to make sure they have it.  We were there with some friends and they had the same problem at check-in.    I will probably try a different place next time.

Summary Heading: couldn't live up to their reservations that were booked
Summary: I booked 2 rooms with 2 beds and a roll away cot approximately 4 weeks ago. I was told to call the day before arriving  to ensure the cot would be available and in place. I called and was told we don't have cots and haven't had them for sometime. I asked what could be done to accommodate us as this was not in the plans. The desk person who I will say was great, called her manager and was told another room was 89.00 period no deal,no fare saver nothing offered!! the manager certainly does not understand the hotel industry and how to accommodate travelers!!  I canceled after booking with the Best Western, something to say for large chains and doing their best for clients.. NEVER AGAIN..PS this manager should go to school and learn how to deal with people....

Summary Heading: do not stay here -- its crap anyway but even the lower price isn't worth dealing with the front desk
Summary: totally incompetent 'management' --  a young, clearly inexperienced lady calling herself the 'front desk manager' is left to make decisions.  awesome.  And of course not quite smart enough to actually make a decision -- not a good combination.     this place makes running a hotel look like one of the hardest jobs out there.

Summary Heading: Clean, convenient, value; the DPHI is fine.
Summary: This place does what it does very well: it is a convenient and efficient rehabilitated motor-inn typical of the past.  You can spend a lot more for not too much more than what DPHI offers: lots of convenient parking, easy outside access to comfortable up-dated rooms, a very nice breakfast, a great staff, and easy access to the best beaches and locations within minutes.  Don't worry about the "old" reviews...it sure looks like it' up and running beautifully now.   I plan to return for another visit with my wife soon.  This is a great pace where couples and families will feel very comfortable for a very reasonable rate.  Talk to Mo if you can.  God bless.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: I booked our 2 night reservation on their website and 5 minutes later received a phone call from them asking me for my credit card #. They said that their website got all of my info EXCEPT the CC# - no explanation. I found that strange. Then when we arrived on Friday night we were told that we would not be given a key because their key system was down. It would hopefully be back up on Saturday. Until then we needed to go to the desk anytime we needed to get into our room. Before I was let into my room the nice girl at the desk called her manager to let him / her know that they were overbooked and would only have a room for us on Friday, but not Saturday...yes, I had a confirmed reservation for 2 nights. She then told me that she would give me a room just for tonight and the

Summary Heading: great room, great location, no problems
Summary: we booked this motel even after reading the reviews, for economy basically.  wanted something near the ocean, with a pool and close to Laguna Beach where we were attending a wedding. Was pleasantly surprised. location was very good, 5 min.walk to beach. Room excellant condition and comfortable, pool good. All facilities close by and staff helpful. Even the coffee with the complimentary breakfast in the lobby was good. We thought it was excellant value for money.

We stayed for 3 nights over the weekend.  I wouldn't recommend it to others.  The experience started with deceptive pictures from the internet.  It's not remote, nor as isolated as they make the it appear.   Jack-in-the-Box is behind it, along with busy, nosy PCH.   The pool, is tiny, with only 3 chairs  provided.  The front desk person told us we had one of the "better rooms" when we checked in.   If this room was one of the "better rooms" I'd hate to see the rest. We were allowed only 1 room key, after having to leave a $50 deposit fee. There were holes, scratches and damage to the walls. The remote was broken.  When I asked for new batteries I was told it wouldn't matter, the code didn't work and "the owner wouldn't give them money to reprogram them." The day desk clerk, had

We stayed here just one night and that was enough.  The room was clean, but that musty motel smell hit us in the face as soon as we opened the door.  Opening the windows and running the air conditioner didn't help.  The towels were thin and scratchy also.  We chose the hotel because it was located near the party we were attending and it was less expensive than the other near by motels.  We still paid over $100 for the one Saturday night.

I had to open the door by shoving it with my shoulders. The hot water handle in the shower did not work, cold morning shower. There was a coffee set up in the room but no coffee maker. There was no remote for the TV. The a/c worked great and it was quiet. The room was also quiet.  The price was reasonable. So it's a crap shoot. Good luck.

When my husband and I and our two grown children arrived (albeit just before midnight)with our reservation confirmations in hand, we were told our names weren't in the reservation log.  We were given the two remaining rooms.  In one, there was a leftover half gallon of milk in the refrigerator and the carpet was filthy (vacuuming alone wouldn't have helped it).  In the other, the water was running in the tub and the faucet handles were broken and resting on the side of the tub.  The woman at the desk frantically called for help, but none was available.  Needless to say, we immediately checked out.  It's a great, convenient location, but the place needs considerable help.

I wasn't expecting much due to previous reviews but this place was great! We were also traveling with two other sets of friends and they were extremely happy with their rooms as well.  The place is very clean. They put clean sheets over and under the blanket which I really like.  Bathroom was spacious, and there was even an extra sink outside of the bathroom with plenty of counter space.  We had a room with two queens and it was very large. Bed was very comfortable. The landscaping is tropical and you could even catch a glimpse of the ocean from our window on the second floor. Our friends used the small pool and found it enjoyable.  There is also a washer and dryer in the pool area which was very handy for drying our suits and towels at the end of the day.  Once the traffic

We arrived at this hotel at 2 pm and the room was not ready. We left and came back at 3:00 and it was still not ready. We waited until 4:15 and was told it was almost ready, that they were short staffed. We had walked aroun d the property and the swimming pool was tiny, the water looked green, there were no chairs available to sit in and there was a washer and dryer on the patio area next to the pool. We decided not to stay as our intentions were to lay out by the pool for an hour before getting ready to go to dinner and then to "The Pageant of The Masters". The man working the front desk was unaccomodating and not helpful at all. He told us he could not refund our money, that we would have to contact Expedia since that was who we had booked through. After the weekend, we

After checking several reviews of this hotel, we decided to stay here during our trip to Orange County to visit our son and his family.  We had coupons from room saver and really got a great deal!  Our son and his family stayed in the next room.  The rooms were clean and quite nice.  They offered more than the other motel we stayed at in Buena Vista (nice breakfast, in room coffee, iron, clock).  At first, we had a hard time finding the place because you can pass it up very easily.  It is almost across from Doheny park.  The desk clerk was nice enough to let us look at the rooms first and get us adjoining rooms with door entry between them.  It was quiet and cozy.  I would recommend this place to everyone.

Summary Heading: I don't care what they say, I would definitely stay here again!
Summary: A couple of observations regarding previous posts on this property... first, the majority of 1-star slams were from around Sept 2008.  Secondly, one post mentioned that new management had recently taken over.  Based on that, I can say with confidence then that new management has successfully addressed many of the problems that have been reported here.  I had no reservations at all about this inn.  As a matter of fact, I would not hesitate to stay here again on future trips to Dana Point.  The room was spacious and neat.  Big screen tv, mini fridge, a/c blows cold.  Linens and towels are changed daily.  I know this cos I was in the room both times that housekeeping came over.  Bathroom had granite countertop, clean floor, hot and cold bath.  Free wifi was fast and free breakfast

I love this place. With the new owners its even better.  I use to stay all the time a few years ago. The price was high for what you get but it was close to the beach and you can walk to a number of places. I stayed again this last November with my mom and it was great. The place is much nicer. It's cleaner then it use to be. The staff is very friendly and very helpful. You're right next to the beach, the Harbor is a short walk down the road. Theres a number of eating places just around the corner and shopping centers all over. Great place. Try it I know you'll love it!! :)

My spouse and I are frequent travelers and try to maximize our travel $$ by staying at modest properties and spending the extra "woulda-spent on accommodations" dollars on fun stuff. We've stayed at a LOT of modest properties, and this is an excellent one.  We read the TripAdvisor reviews AFTER booking the property and were horrified. However, in OUR experience there was nothing to warrant fear or horror. This property met every "must" with appropriate two-star quality. People who are spoiled by three and four-star properties should look elsewhere.   First off, the DPHI is literally right across the street from Doheny State Park beach. EASY walking distance. In five minutes from your door you are on the beach. The property is just off noisy, busy Hwy 1 but we suffered none of

We recently stayed at The Dana Point Harbor Inn while we were in town for a wedding. BAD CHOICE!  The second day we were there the hot water heater broke and we had to take cold showers! When asking when it would get fixed they informed us that " you have running water"  It took a whole day to get it fixed and management never even apologized or offered any sort of compensation. Also the supposed Wi-Fi only worked if we went outside the room.

My husband and I had the misfortune of staying one night here.  God help us; the bedspread was dirty and dreadfully old, a huge 8 foot wall mirror had a crack spreading across the whole thing and the bed was shaped and felt like a surf board.  There was no water pressure to speak of, and some of the faucets didn't work .  We told them within an hour that we would NOT be staying the other 2 nights we had booked and wanted a refund for those 2 nights.  This was well within the 24-hour cancellation period their website promised.  When we returned the key in the morning and checked out, we were informed by the clerk that he couldn't do anything about returning our money for the remaining nights that we wouldn't be staying.  We said fine, we'll just dispute it with VISA.  Two weeks

Absolutely the worst hotel I've ever seen or been in! What a HOLE! The tile in the bath room looked like it had been done by a five year old. There was no hair dryer and when I asked for one, sitll nothing. This place was unreal, I almost left to demand my money back to stay at the Holiday Inn Express next door for fifty dollars more. Oh boy, I hope this review saves someone else from staying at this disgusting place. I was promised two rooms together, didn't get it. When I was asked to be moved Dan the front desk clerk couldn't find the key to the new room so he just made one up. When I walked into the room....there was already someone in it, and they had a dog running around. Words just can't discribe just HOW BAD this place really is!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  STAY AWAY FROM THE DANA

I would not stay at this hotel again nor would I recommend it to anyone. The location is awesome, but the rooms are horrible.The carpets are filthy, the blankets have holes in them, the tubs are also very dirty and rusting in areas.  They had pavement drilling going on right outside our door, on their property in the parking lot)  and the manager refused to discount the rate with the excuse that it was "government" work. The manager was very unprofessional, he said he would "check" and then never even bothered to call back with the answer.  We had a medical emergency and it took 3 calls to the front desk to convince them to call 911 . I think this was just inexperience or lacking of training for the front desk clerk.  We called the front desk thinking it would be the fastest way
First read all reviews and don't belelive the one that are good.  Second, I had to clean the bathroom myself...

You get what you pay for and this hotel was a reasonable value for the money, actually a good value for my family of six as I got 2 rooms side by side from a travel website for less than what I have seen quoted in other reviews. It is just a short LEVEL three minute walk to a very nice beach and park.  Unlike the Marriott above it, you don't have a steep hill to walk up and down, and ulike the Holiday Inn Express behind it, you don't have a busy boulevard to cross.  I felt comfortable having my young teenage kids walk unacompanied between the beach and the hotel, and we could lug all our stuff to the beach without having to drive and find a parking spot. The hotel appeared to be family run, and everyone was nice and accomodating.  The cleaning staff was friendly and quiet. The

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For, Not Much
Summary: This is the cheapest hotel in Dana Point, so dont expect much.  The only reason I stayed here was because I was checking in at midnight and had to be on the road again at 7:00 AM.  I knew what I was getting myself into after reading the previous reviews, so I was prepared.  It lived up to its reputation.  This hotel is equivalent to a Motel 6, with a nicer bathroom (interesting place to find granite counters), but not as clean.  If you are looking for lodging in Dana Point, dont want to pay much, and dont care about "clean", this is your place.    I have a tough time giving this motel a "terrible" rating because I dont think it is trying to represent itself for anything other than it is; the only budget motel in the area.  But I cant bring myself to even rate it an "OK" because

I would stay here only if completely desperate. I've stayed in many budget hotels and this was by far the worst. You know things are bad when you arrive and the front desk clerk and her husband are watching television and eating their dinner off of paper plates behind the counter.  But it only got worse. Even though it was a non-smoking room, it smelled smokey and dingy. Chairs and other furnishings were threadbare and worn. Front door swing-lock broken. Closet doors don't match. Phone light flashing on and off all night even though I didn't have a message. Paint peeling off bathroom door. Thin ceiling that creaked and popped with every step of my upstairs neighbors. But the worst part was when, at 1:30 AM, I was awoken by the sound of something smashing loudly into the wall of

My wife and I stayed here two nights, Friday and Saturday.  Great location as it is very close to Doheny State Beach and is a 3 minute walk to the beach, but this place is a dive.   It's got that old, run-down looking motel 6-like atmosphere.  Our room was upstairs.  The sink didn't work properly, the carpet was disgusting, and I witnessed a domestic dispute between some man who was banging on the door of his room, yelling at his wife to let him in.  The continental breakfast was the worst I've ever seen.  A real sham!  This is really a ratty place for the money we paid which was almost $150 a night.  These rooms should rent for less than $70 a night.  I was kicking myself that I didn't pay the extra $50 a night and get a reservation at the deluxe Dana Point resort right next

Summary Heading: Dirty place not fit for romance
Summary: Seriously, this motel is no place for a couple.  Single and want to stay in a dumpy dirty Motel 6 type hotel...you are in luck for a cheap hotel at a high price.  In my world this is a $39 a night room not $99.  Expect grey (non-bleached white) towels with a foul odor. My wife slept on top of the covers for fear of bed bugs...i didn't get bite, sleeping under the covers.  It is close but not walking distance to the Dana Point Warf...so you may as well stay further away.  There is no view from here.  But you could walk to the State park about 2 blocks away for a view of the ocean.  For my money I'd spend a little more for a clean respectable hotel.

Our stay exceeded our expectations. Some previous reviews left us worried but we fiqured for one nite the price is great. We arrived early,actually 10:30am. We wanted to park there and visit our family. We were told our room was ready and we could check in. No extra charge. $89.00 per nite; after taxes the total was $97.98 Approaching the room we noticed the landscaping was attractive and well maintained and the grounds were clean. There is plenty of parking also.  The room was a delightful surprise. A king sized bed had a very attractive early American carpet bag type bed spread. There was an over stuffed chair in early American, a straight back padded chair and a straight back desk chair. There is a desk; that on either side has two dresser units. One; with the TV had two 30"

This was our last and most "spontaneous" stop before heading back home. We laugh now, but as we got there, it was a little sad. Our from door had a whole in it covered with tape. The mattress and pillows were hard like rocks. The covers had a blood smudge on them. I didn't even take a shower, thought it was better not to. There was a creepy guy literally living downstairs, and was keen on talking to us. As we got back from supper, there was a "poker" game going on in the room next to us with the door open. Weird. Definately not worth 100$!

Hotel was close to shops and restaurants- which is good. In our hotel room the sliding door wasn't locking properly, had someone come in and fix it.  The bathroom sink had large scratches on them which wasn't appealing. But overall the front desk employees seemed somewhat helpful. The cleaning staff did a great job keeping the rooms  clean and restocking shampoo and soaps.

If you like a rock hard bed stay in room 201. The bed was hard as the floor! We had to sleep on the folded bedspread and pillows to get comfortable. The free breakfast was just so.. so..  The coffee was weak and the food selection wasn't anything to write home about. They say, WiFi is availbale in all rooms. It is, but you have to sign up and pay $5.95 an hour. We drove up PCH and used the library's wireless internet connection  for free. The room was large with nice size bathroom. Great location for the activities around the harbor.  We love the area, but next time we will stay someplace else. Why? 1. The bed 2. Poor breakfast 3. Mislead by having to pay for wireless internet connection.

The Good: We stayed here for one night, checked in late 11:00 pm and had no problems getting to the room. We couldn't hear any noise from the street and found that the beach is no more than a five minute walk and Del Taco/ Mc Donalds are behind the hotel.  Bad: The room we stayed in appreared to be under construction, with water stained plaster on the shower ceiling, broken shower knobs , but new counters in the bathroom. Furniture was from the 70's, and their breakfast hasn't worth eating. Parking lot had rolls of old carpet in them..  Paid $89.00 for the night, not bad when you only need a few hours sleep and are gone in the moring.-    Maybe it will be better if they redo the whole place.

We stayed at the Harbor Inn for three nights, February 26 thru 28, 2006.  The employees were friendly, the room was clean and spacious, and the price we paid was a good value.  But...don't plan to eat breakfast here. Food selection was limited at best, rolls were stale and there was no milk for cereal.

Just returned last night from a long weekend at the Harbor Inn in Dana Point.   It was a ladies getaway and we each had our own rooms.  We researched all the hotel and wanted something reasonably priced which the Harbor Inn was.  On the plus side:  The room was spacious, the king bed was comfortable, the air conditioning worked great, and the layout was convenient.  The best thing is the place is across the street from the Doheny State beach.  Bought cheap chairs and towel at SavOn and walked across the road.  Many of the more expensive hotels were less desirably located.  On the negative side:  The decor is slightly shabby,  it was the July 4th weekend and learing people hung out side their rooms smoking at all hours which was a little intimidating, the place is motel style, 2

Dana Point Harbor Inn is a clean, comfortable and a nice place to stay at if you're visiting Dana Point or Laguna Beach. It's on the road to the Dana Point Marina and located right at the corner of PCH and Dana Point Harbor Drive.  We had a King size bed and the room was large and very comfortable.  Only complaint is the breakfast which was nothing special.  Great location even though not on the beach. Close to the Lantern district and its numerous restaurants. We ate at the "Thai This" restaurant and I highly recommend that too. 20 mins drive right up PCH to Laguna Beach.  Cost $90 for a saturday night April 30, 2005.

This hotel isn't the fanciest ever, but it sure has a great location! The rooms were basic, but clean which is all that matters because you won't be spending much time there anyways. I thought our room was of good value, and would stay here again.

We motored down from LA to see the whales off Dana Point, and booked into the Dana Point Harbor Inn for 4 nights. The hotel is divided into 2 blocks, and offer smoking and non smoking rooms. We booked into a non smoking room on the top floor. The room was clean and well looked after, with fridge, iron, coffee making kit and 120 channel TV. We had a huge double bed, and the room had AC's which worked. All four nights were quiet and no rowdy elements were encountered, the rooms were changed every day, and my wife and I thought it was a really good place to stay. Each morning there was a free continenetal breakfast which is taken in the hotel reception in immaculate suroundings and well worth getting up for.The beach is just across the road, and the hotel is situated right in the

I am from Canada and I came to this place on JAN/16/2005 to get a quote for 4 rooms in July 2005 for my extended family which will be attending the wedding in the area. A week later I called to confirm the reservation and got the confirmation number. The first week of February I received the call from the hotel and was told that they will not honor the rate as per reservation because they gave me the winter rate instead of the summer rate. My arguments about confirmed reservation and considering this to be a binding contract between two parties did not help. So, on FEB/19/2005 I called and canceled my reservation. Now I still face the challenge to find another place. I would warn everybody to be very careful if/when doing the business with those people in the future.
